sources.data_found: Lists VACC resources including DeepGreen (massively parallel) and Bluemoon.
2022 Degree Completion Data: Computer Science Bachelors (117), Master's (16), Research Doctorate (2).
IceCore GPU cluster specs: H100, A100, V100, and H200 upgrades.
2024-2025 Common Data Set (no specific CS enrollment).

student_data.notes: Student counts are estimates derived from 2022 degree completion data (Degrees Awarded × Year Multiplier) sourced from DataUSA/IPEDS, as exact departmental enrollment is not available in the public 2024-2025 Common Data Set.

other_high_vram_gpus.model: NVIDIA RTX PRO 6000 Blackwell Server Edition

gpu_resources.notes: GPU counts represent the highest values found across models. V100 count (160) derives from DeepGreen cluster specs (80 nodes x 2 GPUs). H100 (8), A100 (4), and H200 (104) counts derive from IceCore cluster specs and announced upgrades (Phase 1 & 2). Note: H200 and RTX 6000 resources are part of upgrades scheduled for late 2025/2026.

analysis_notes: Ensemble result aggregated from OpenAI and Gemini models. VACC (Vermont Advanced Computing Core) operates the primary clusters: DeepGreen (V100-based) and IceCore (heterogeneous mix including H100/A100 and upcoming H200s). Student data is estimated from degree completions due to lack of direct enrollment figures.
validation_notes: No changes made. All GPU resources appear to be university-owned. Student data is already estimated.
